documenttitle.text: Red Hat Security Advisory: autotrace security update

note.text:
An update for autotrace is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
AutoTrace is a program for converting bitmaps to vector graphics.

Security Fix(es):

* autotrace: heap-buffer overflow via the ReadImage() at input-bmp.c (CVE-2022-32323)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.2 Release Notes linked from the References section.
note.title: Details

note.text: A buffer overflow flaw was found in the autotrace package. This flaw allows an attacker to trick the user into opening a maliciously crafted BMP image, triggering arbitrary code execution or causing the application to crash.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

reference.Description: bz#2107471: heap-buffer overflow via the ReadImage() at input-bmp.c

fullproductname.text: autotrace-0:0.31.1-65.el9 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux CRB (v. 9)
